intro: Siler zernyi subsp. ochridanum, commonly known as the Ochridan siler, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is found in mountainous regions of the Balkans. It has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, dry fruits. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its limited distribution and ecological adaptations.
